sen.j: 石川貞清（いしかわ さだきよ、生年不詳 - 寛永3年4月8日 (旧暦)（1626年5月3日））は、安土桃山時代の武将・大名。
sen.e: Sadakiyo ISHIKAWA (year of birth and death unknown - May 3, 1626) was a busho (military commander)/daimyo (feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Sadakiyo ISHIKAWA (year of birth and death unknown - May 3, 1626) was a busho (military commander) and daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.e: He served for Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI as tsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) and kinno kirisaki sashimono tsukaiban, and rendered distinguished service in the Siege of Odawara.

sen.j: 天正18年（1590年）尾張国犬山藩1万2千石（のち12万石）を領し、また、豊臣氏の信濃国木曾の太閤蔵入地10万石の代官としても活躍した。
sen.e: He became in 1590 the lord of Inuyama domain in Owari Province, whose kokudaka (crop yield) was 12.000 goku (1 koku is about 18 litters) (later 120, 000 goku), and he also worked as the daikan (local governor) of taiko kurairechi (the land directly controlled by Taiko Hideyoshi) of 100,000 goku owned by the Toyotomi clan at Kiso in Shinano Province.

sen.e: He became in 1590 the lord of Inuyama Domain in Owari Province, whose kokudaka (crop yield) was 12.000 koku (1 koku is about 180 litters) (later 120, 000 koku), and he also worked as the daikan (local governor) of taiko kurairechi (the land directly controlled by Taiko Hideyoshi) of 100,000 koku owned by the Toyotomi clan at Kiso in Shinano Province.

He became in 1590 the lord of Inuyama Domain in Owari Province, whose kokudaka (crop yield) was 12.000 koku (1 koku is about 180 litters) (later 120, 000 koku), and he also worked as the daikan (local governor) of taiko kurairechi (the land directly controlled by Taiko Hideyoshi) of 100,000 koku owned by the Toyotomi clan at Kiso in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 天正19年、文禄の役の拠点となる肥前国名護屋城の普請工事を担った。
sen.e: In 1591, he took charge of the construction of Nagoya-jo castle in Hizen Province which was supposed to be the base of Bunroku campaign.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いにおいて西軍につき、居城の犬山城に稲葉貞通・稲葉典通父子、稲葉方通（稲葉一鉄4男）、加藤貞泰、関一政、竹中重門らと籠城。
sen.e: He sided with the West squad in the battle of Sekigahara, and he confined himself to Inuyama-jo castle together with Sadamichi INABA, Norimichi INABA, Masamichi INABA (the fourth son of Ittetsu INABA), Sadayasu Kato, Kazumasa SEKI and Shigekado TAKENAKA.

sen.j: しかし、彼らは極秘に東軍の井伊直政に密書を送り、内応を約定して引き上げていった。
sen.e: They however secretly contacted with Naomasa II of the East squad, promised to cooperate him and left the castle.
They however secretly contacted with Naomasa II of the eastern camp, promised to cooperate him and left the castle.

sen.j: その後、城を出て本戦に参加、宇喜多隊の右翼、口北野付近に陣した。
sen.e: He then departed from the castle and participated in the battle by pitching a camp at Kuchikitano, the west wing of Ukita force.
He then departed from the castle and participated in the battle by pitching a camp around Kuchikitano, the west wing of Ukita force.

sen.j: 敗戦後所領を没収されたが、犬山籠城中に東軍に加担した木曽郷士らの人質を解放したことが評価されたのと池田輝政の働きかけにより黄金千枚で助命された。
sen.e: His territory was forfeited after he was defeated, but his life was saved in exchange of a thousand sheets of gold plate thanks to the fact that he released local samurai of Kiso who were captured at Inuyama-jo castle as the cooperators of the East squad and the influence of Terumasa IKEDA.

sen.j: 剃髪して宗林と号し、京都で隠棲し、茶道・商人（金融業）として余生を過ごした。
sen.e: Thereafter, he shaved his head, called himself Sorin and spent his rest of life in Kyoto as a man of tea and a merchant (financial business).

sen.j: 石川貞清の妻（重正の妻との説もある）は、真田幸村として知られる真田信繁の七女おかね（於金殿）とされる。
sen.e: Sadakiyo ISHIKAWA's wife (some say Shigemasa's wife) is believed to have been Okane (Okane-dono), the seventh daughter of Nobushige Sanada who is known as Yukimura SANADA.

sen.e: It has been passed down that Sorin, who had succeeded as a merchant (financial business), assisted Chikurin-in, the legal wife of Nobushige (Okane's mother and a daughter or adopted daughter of Yoshitsugu Otani), throughout her life after Nobushige died in the Siege of Ozaka,.
